h8101.definition: patronymically from {{h8093}}; a Shimathite (collectively) or descendants of Shimah; Shimeathites.

h8102.definition: from an unused root meaning to emit a sound; an inkling; a little.

h8103.definition: feminine of {{h8102}}; scornful whispering (of hostile spectators); shame.

h8104.definition: a primitive root; properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.; beward, be circumspect, take heed (to self), keep(-er, self), mark, look narrowly, observe, preserve, regard, reserve, save (self), sure, (that lay) wait (for), watch(-man).

h8105.definition: from {{h8104}}; something preserved, i.e. the settlings (plural only) of wine; dregs, (wines on the) lees.

h8106.definition: the same as {{h8105}}; Shemer, the name of three Israelites; Shamer, Shemer.

h8108.definition: feminine of an unused noun from {{h8104}} meaning a guard; watchfulness; watch.

h8109.definition: feminine of passive participle of {{h8104}}; something guarded, i.e. an eye-lid; waking.

h8110.definition: from {{h8105}} in its original sense; guardianship; Shimron, the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine; Shimron.

h8111.definition: from the active participle of {{h8104}}; watch-station; Shomeron, a place in Palestine; Samaria.

h8112.definition: from {{h8110}} and a derivative of {{h4754}}; guard of lashing; Shimron-Meron, a place in Palestine; Shimon-meron.

h8113.definition: from {{h8105}} in its original sense; watchful; Shimri, the name of four Israelites; Shimri.

h8114.definition: or שְׁמַרְיָהוּ; from {{h8104}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has guarded; Shemarjah, the name of four Israelites; Shamariah, Shemariah.

h8115.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h8111}}; Shomrain, a place in Palestine; Samaria.

h8116.definition: feminine of {{h8113}}; female guard; Shimrith, a Moabitess; Shimrith.

h8117.definition: patronymically from {{h8110}}; a Shimronite (collectively) or descendants of Shimron; Shimronites.

h8118.definition: patrial from {{h8111}}; a Shomeronite (collectively) or inhabitants of Shomeron; Samaritans.

h8119.definition: from {{h8104}}; guardship; Shimrath, an Israelite; Shimrath.

h8120.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to the root of {{h8121}} through the idea of activity implied in day-light; to serve; minister.

h8121.definition: from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; east side(-ward), sun (rising),   west(-ward), window. See also {{h1053}}.

h8123.definition: from {{h8121}}; sunlight; Shimshon, an Israelite; Samson.

h8124.definition: (Aramaic) from {{h8122}}; sunny; Shimshai, a Samaritan; Shimshai.

h8125.definition: apparently from {{h8121}}; sunlike; Shamsherai, an Israelite; Shamsherai.

h8126.definition: patronymically from an unused name from {{h7762}} probably meaning garlic-smell; a Shumathite (collectively) or descendants of Shumah; Shumathites.

h8127.definition: from {{h8150}}; compare	{{h8143}}; a tooth (as sharp); specifically ivory; figuratively, a cliff; crag, × forefront, ivory, × sharp, tooth.

h8129.definition: the same as {{h8127}}; crag; Shen, a place in Palestine; Shen.

h8130.definition: a primitive root; to hate (personally); enemy, foe, (be) hate(-ful, -r), odious, × utterly.

h8132.definition: a primitive root; to alter; change.

h8134.definition: probably from {{h8132}} and {{h1}}; a father has turned; Shinab, a Canaanite; Shinab.

h8137.definition: apparently of Babylonian origin; Shenatstsar, an Israelite; Senazar.

h8138.definition: a primitive root; to fold, i.e. duplicate (literally or figuratively); by implication, to transmute (transitive or intransitive); do (speak, strike) again, alter, double, (be given to) change, disguise, (be) diverse, pervert, prefer, repeat, return, do the second time.

h8141.definition: (in plural or (feminine) שָׁנָה; from {{h8138}}; a year (as a revolution of time); whole age, × long,   old, year(× -ly).

h8143.definition: from {{h8127}} and the plural apparently of a foreign word; probably, tooth of elephants, i.e. ivory tusk; ivory.

h8144.definition: of uncertain derivation; crimson, properly, the insect or its color, also stuff dyed with it; crimson, scarlet (thread).

h8145.definition: from {{h8138}}; properly, double, i.e. second; also adverbially, again; again, either (of them), (an-) other, second (time).

h8147.definition: dual of {{h8145}}; feminine שְׁתַּיִם; two; also (as ordinal) twofold; both, couple, double, second, twain,   twelfth,   twelve,   twenty (sixscore) thousand, twice, two.

h8148.definition: from {{h8150}}; something pointed, i.e. a gibe; byword, taunt.

h8149.definition: or שְׂנִיר; from an unused root meaning to be pointed; peak; Shenir or Senir, a summit of Lebanon; Senir, Shenir.

h8150.definition: a primitive root; to point (transitive or intransitive); intensively, to pierce; figuratively, to inculcate; prick, sharp(-en), teach diligently, whet.

h8151.definition: a primitive root; to compress (with a belt); gird up.

h8152.definition: probably of foreign derivation; Shinar, a plain in Babylonia; Shinar.

h8154.definition: or שָׁשָׂה; (Isaiah 10:13), a primitive root; to plunder; destroyer, rob, spoil(-er).

h8155.definition: a primitive root; to plunder; rifle, spoil.

h8156.definition: a primitive root; to split or tear; figuratively, to upbraid; cleave, (be) cloven (footed), rend, stay.

h8158.definition: a primitive root; to cut in pieces, i.e. slaughter; hew in pieces.

h8159.definition: a primitive root; to gaze at or about (properly, for help); by implication, to inspect, consider, compassionate, be nonplussed (as looking around in amazement) or bewildered; depart, be dim, be dismayed, look (away), regard, have respect, spare, turn.

h8160.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h8159}}; properly, a look, i.e. a moment; hour.

h8161.definition: feminine from an unused root meaning to stamp; a clatter (of hoofs); stamping.

h8162.definition: probably of foreign derivation; linsey-woolsey, i.e. cloth of linen and wool carded and spun together; garment of divers sorts, linen and wollen.

h8163.definition: or שָׂעִר; from {{h8175}}; shaggy; as noun, a he-goat; by analogy, a faun; devil, goat, hairy, kid, rough, satyr.

h8164.definition: formed the same as {{h8163}}; a shower (as tempestuous); small rain.

h8165.definition: formed like {{h8163}}; rough; Seir, a mountain of Idumaea and its aboriginal occupants, also one in Palestine; Seir.

h8167.definition: formed as {{h8166}}; roughness; Seirah, a place in Palestine; Seirath.

h8168.definition: from an unused root meaning to hollow out; the palm; by extension, a handful; handful, hollow of the hand.

h8169.definition: or שַׁעֲלַבִּין; plural from {{h7776}}; fox-holes; Shaalbim or Shaalabbin, a place in Palestine; Shaalabbin, Shaalbim.

h8170.definition: patrial from {{h8169}}; a Shaalbonite or inhabitant of Shaalbin; Shaalbonite.

h8171.definition: plural of {{h7776}}; foxes; Shaalim, a place in Palestine; Shalim.

h8172.definition: a primitive root; to support one's self; lean, lie, rely, rest (on, self), stay.

h8173.definition: a primitive root; (in a good acceptation) to look upon (with complacency), i.e. fondle, please or amuse (self); (in a bad one) to look about (in dismay), i.e. stare; cry (out) (by confusion with {{h7768}}), dandle, delight (self), play, shut.

h8174.definition: from {{h5586}}; fluctuation; Shaaph, the name of two Israelites; Shaaph.

h8175.definition: a primitive root; to storm; by implication, to shiver, i.e. fear; be (horribly) afraid, fear, hurl as a storm, be tempestuous, come like (take away as with) a whirlwind.

h8176.definition: a primitive root; to split or open, i.e. (literally, but only as denominative from {{h8179}}); compare see {{h7778}}; to act as gatekeeper; (figuratively) to estimate; think.

h8178.definition: from {{h8175}}; a terror; affrighted, × horribly, × sore, storm. See {{h8181}}.

h8179.definition: from {{h8176}} in its original sense; an opening, i.e. door or gate; city, door, gate, port (× -er).

h8180.definition: from {{h8176}}; a measure (as a section); (hundred-) fold.

h8181.definition: or שַׂעַר; (Isaiah 7:20), from {{h8175}} in the sense of dishevelling; hair (as if tossed or bristling); hair(-y), × rough.

h8182.definition: from {{h8176}}; harsh or horrid, i.e. offensive; vile.

h8183.definition: feminine of {{h8178}}; a hurricane; storm, tempest.

h8184.definition: or שְׂעוֹרָה (feminine meaning the plant); and (masculine meaning the grain); also שְׂעֹר; or שְׂעוֹר; from {{h8175}} in the sense of roughness; barley (as villose); barley.

h8186.definition: or שַׁעֲרִירִיָּה; or שַׁעֲרֻרִת; feminine from {{h8176}} in the sense of {{h8175}}; something fearful; horrible thing.

h8187.definition: from {{h8176}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has stormed; Shearjah, an Israelite; Sheariah.

h8188.definition: masculine plural of {{h8184}}; barley grains; Seorim, an Israelite; Seorim.

h8189.definition: dual of {{h8179}}; double gates; Shaarajim, a place in Palestine; Shaaraim.

h8190.definition: of Persian derivation; Shaashgaz, a eunuch of Xerxes; Shaashgaz.

h8192.definition: a primitive root; to abrade, i.e. bare; high, stick out.

h8193.definition: or (in dual and plural) שֶׂפֶת; probably from {{h5595}} or {{h8192}} through the idea of termination (compare {{h5490}}); the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.); band, bank, binding, border, brim, brink, edge, language, lip, prating, (sea-)shore, side, speech, talk, (vain) words.

h8194.definition: from {{h8192}} in the sense of clarifying; a cheese (as strained from the whey); cheese.

h8195.definition: or שְׁפִי; from {{h8192}}; baldness (compare {{h8205}}); Shepho or Shephi, an Idumaean; Shephi, Shepho.

h8196.definition: or שְׁפוּט; from {{h8199}}; a judicial sentence, i.e. punishment; judgment.

h8197.definition: or שְׁפוּפָן; from the same as {{h8207}}; serpent-like; Shephupham, an Israelite; Shephuphan, Shupham.

h8198.definition: feminine from an unused root meaning to spread out (as a family; see {{h4940}}); a female slave (as a member of the household); (bond-, hand-) maid(-en, -servant), wench, bondwoman, womanservant.

h8199.definition: a primitive root; to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively); avenge, × that condemn, contend, defend, execute (judgment), (be a) judge(-ment), × needs, plead, reason, rule.
